feature.name: daily wage calculator
feature.description: Operational reality summary for "daily wage calculator" based on Jira evidence: - Findings / issues / limitations: 10 - Troubleshooting / edge cases / requests: 7 - Evidence suggests asynchronous updates or synchronization considerations. - Evidence includes UI/visibility or copy/label concerns.

findings.group_description: Client requires an automated salary calculation system based on 26 working days per month with dynamic adjustments for worked days
findings.issue_explanation: Current system cannot automatically calculate salary based on actual working days, requiring manual interventions and separate tracking
findings.limitation_statement: The Bayzat payroll system lacks automated salary calculation based on precise working days. The platform cannot dynamically adjust salaries proportionally when employees work more or fewer than the standard 26 working days.
findings.gap_statement: There is a significant product gap in automated, attendance-driven salary calculation. The system currently requires manual tracking of overtime, unpaid leaves, and does not support automatic pro-rata salary adjustments per employee.

findings.group_description: System fails to automatically update unpaid leave deductions when salary configurations change after leave request creation
findings.issue_explanation: Deductions were calculated based on outdated salary configurations instead of the most recent salary setup, resulting in incorrect payroll deductions
findings.limitation_statement: Cannot dynamically recalculate pending leave deductions when salary configurations are modified after leave request submission
findings.gap_statement: Lacks automatic synchronization between salary configuration changes and pending leave deduction calculations

findings.group_description: End of Service (EOS) calculation produces consistently slightly lower amounts due to decimal precision errors in pro-rated salary computation.
findings.issue_explanation: When calculating pro-rated End of Service amounts, the system shows amounts that are less than expected by 0.1 or 0.2 decimal points, affecting all employees regardless of departure date.
findings.limitation_statement: The daily wage calculation engine has limited decimal precision when computing pro-rated amounts for employees leaving mid-month.
findings.gap_statement: The system needs enhanced rounding and decimal handling mechanisms to ensure exact financial calculations for end of service settlements.

findings.group_description: Discrepancy in handling leap year days during gratuity calculation, specifically around February 29th inclusion and service duration counting
findings.issue_explanation: The system's gratuity calculation may not transparently handle leap year day inclusion, causing minor differences in total service days calculation
findings.limitation_statement: Lack of clear documentation about how leap year days are precisely counted in service duration calculations
findings.gap_statement: Need for a clear, user-facing explanation of gratuity calculation methodology, including leap year and departure date handling

findings.group_description: Users can manually edit the automatically calculated gratuity amount without system validation
findings.issue_explanation: The platform allows direct editing of gratuity calculations, potentially introducing discrepancies between system and manual calculations
findings.limitation_statement: No built-in validation to prevent or warn about manual overrides of system-calculated gratuity amounts
findings.gap_statement: Need for a mechanism to validate or flag manually edited gratuity calculations

findings.group_description: System uses a fixed daily wage calculation method that cannot be customized by clients
findings.issue_explanation: Platform calculates daily wage using a hardcoded formula of (Basic Salary / 30), which differs from some client preferences like (Basic Salary × 12 / 365)
findings.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculation method is fixed and cannot be modified via configuration
findings.gap_statement: No flexibility exists for organizations with different daily wage computation methodologies

findings.group_description: Independent daily wage calculation configurations for leave salary and salary proration cause calculation discrepancies
findings.issue_explanation: The system calculates leave salary and salary proration using separate daily wage formulas with different divisors (30 vs 30.42 days), leading to inconsistent salary calculations
findings.limitation_statement: The platform cannot automatically align daily wage calculations between leave salary and salary proration scenarios without manual configuration
findings.gap_statement: Lack of a unified daily wage calculation method that consistently applies across different payroll scenarios

findings.group_description: System experiences data synchronization issues when calculating daily wage during unpaid leave, particularly around public holiday configurations
findings.issue_explanation: Public holiday additions after leave request creation cause mismatches between HR and Payroll systems' working days calculations, resulting in incorrect salary deductions
findings.limitation_statement: The platform cannot automatically recalculate daily wage deductions retroactively when public holidays are added after leave requests are processed
findings.gap_statement: Need for real-time synchronization between Time Off and Payroll modules to ensure accurate working days calculation and consistent salary deduction

findings.group_description: Daily wage calculation for unpaid leave uses a non-standard divisor that can produce deduction amounts different from expected monthly salary
findings.issue_explanation: The system calculates unpaid leave deductions using a custom daily wage divisor (30.42 days) instead of calendar days, which can result in deduction amounts that exceed the expected monthly salary
findings.limitation_statement: The payroll system uses a fixed 30.42-day divisor for daily wage calculations, which may not align with user expectations of exact monthly salary deductions
findings.gap_statement: Lack of transparent explanation for complex payroll calculation methods, especially around leave deductions that might exceed expected monthly salary amounts

findings.group_description: System has a global configuration for unpaid leave calculations that overrides individual policy-level settings
findings.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator applies a global daily rate configuration that supersedes policy-specific leave deduction calculation methods, potentially leading to unexpected salary deductions
findings.limitation_statement: Users cannot customize leave deduction calculations at the policy level when a global setting exists
findings.gap_statement: The system lacks flexibility in handling nuanced leave policy configurations across different work schedules

troubleshooting.group_description: Temporary method for handling salary variations when automated calculation is not available
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Use a mix of unpaid leaves and overtime tracking, managed separately for each employee

troubleshooting.group_description: When daily wage calculation produces incorrect deductions due to public holiday timing, limited manual resolution options exist
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: 1. Apply manual deduction to correct the salary amount, 2. Potentially reopen previous payroll cycles (not recommended)

troubleshooting.group_description: Resolving discrepancies in gratuity amount calculations
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Manually verify calculation by: 1) Checking total service days including leap year days, 2) Confirming departure date is counted as a working day, 3) Dividing total days by 365 to calculate service years

troubleshooting.group_description: Manual verification required when daily wage calculation differs from platform's default method
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Manually cross-check gratuity calculations using alternative daily wage formulas when platform's fixed (Basic/30) method doesn't match client expectations

troubleshooting.group_description: Manual configuration required to align leave salary and salary proration daily wage calculations
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Manually configure both leave salary and salary proration daily wage formulas to use the same divisor (e.g., 30.42 days)

troubleshooting.group_description: How to calculate unpaid leave deductions using the system's daily wage method
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: To calculate unpaid leave deduction: Divide monthly salary by 30.42 to get daily wage, then multiply by number of leave days

troubleshooting.group_description: Resolving discrepancies in unpaid leave deduction calculations requires checking global daily rate configuration
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Verify global daily rate configuration before investigating policy-level calculation issues

glossary.definition: Salary calculation method based on 26 working days per month, derived from 365 annual days minus 52 weekly offs, resulting in 313 working days per year divided by 12 months
Calculated by dividing total monthly salary by 30.41 to determine daily wage rate
Final salary settlement calculation for an employee leaving the company, typically involving pro-rated salary computation.
Proportional salary calculation based on the exact number of days worked, computed as (basic + allowances / 30) for the specific period of employment.

End of service benefit calculated based on employee's length of service, basic salary, and contract type, typically using a formula of daily wage multiplied by days per year based on total service period
Total number of days worked, including the departure date, used to calculate years of service for gratuity computation by dividing by 365
The number of days used to calculate the daily rate of salary (e.g., 30 or 30.42 days), which can vary between leave salary and salary proration calculations
The base component of an employee's salary used for calculating leave deductions and other financial calculations
